Description: Terracotta mould-made female worshipper figure wearing peplos and holding nipple. White coating preserved on some areas. Light brown fabric with grey core, common fine silver mica, grey-black and rare white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Female worshipper in Classical Greek style. Fabric likely East Greek, but not Rhodian. Paralles from Rhodes and Attica dated c.450BC and 460BC (Higgins 1970, nos. 204-7, no. 669).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DB.339) (Phase 1)
